definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: The trousers were bespattered  with mud.
sentences.chinese: 裤子被溅起的污泥弄脏了。

sentences.english: Fuck the squeegee men dirtying up the clean windshield of my car.
sentences.chinese: 该死的那个弄脏我车窗的流浪汉。

sentences.english: Her kerchief is dirty with oil.
STAIN】The tablecloth is stained where food has been spilled.
sentences.chinese: 在食物洒出的地方，桌布被弄脏了。

sentences.english: I've mucked up my shirt by working in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我在花园里工作，把衬衣弄脏了。

sentences.english: Thus I now write with a hook and smudge my writing.
sentences.chinese: 因此我现在写了钩和弄脏我的写作。

sentences.english: The children's muddy shoes defiled all the rugs in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们满是泥污的鞋子把宾馆的地毯全都弄脏了。

sentences.english: My self corrupting salving thy amiss.
sentences.chinese: 弄脏我自己来洗涤你的罪愆。

sentences.english: Tears fall down will dirty face.
sentences.chinese: 眼泪掉下来的时候会弄脏脸。

sentences.english: Is d. give a intersection, blame the humble dirty gown.
sentences.chinese: 正婷羞怒交集，怨一介弄脏晚装。

sentences.english: Try not to dirty your new white shirt.
sentences.chinese: 设法别弄脏你的白衬衫。

sentences.english: This book is cheap because it was shop-soiled.
sentences.chinese: 这本书便宜，是因为作为样书给弄脏了。

sentences.english: Her spoiling my dress was deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 她是成心把我的衣服弄脏。

sentences.english: The tablecloth is stained where food has been spilled.
sentences.chinese: 在食物洒出的地方，桌布被弄脏了。

sentences.english: They know the rewards are there if you're prepared to get your hands dirty.
sentences.chinese: 他们很清楚弄脏双手干体力活的报酬有多么优厚。

definition: to mess up/to put into disorder/to meddle with/to confuse
water spot/water stain/wet spot/damp patch/water damage
(of sth sharp) to snag (one's stockings etc)
to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
